name: Nitrogen
structureNotes: Solidifies at cryogenic temperatures; forms β-N2 phase.

name: Oxygen
structureNotes: Solidifies in several phases; α and β phases are monoclinic.

name: Phosphorus
structureNotes: Depends on allotrope (e.g., black phosphorus is orthorhombic).

name: Iron
structureNotes: Ferrite (α-Fe) is bcc; austenite (γ-Fe) is fcc at higher temps.

name: Cobalt
structureNotes: Can transform to fcc at high temperature.

name: Tin
structureNotes: White tin (β-Sn) is metallic; grey tin is diamond cubic.

name: Mercury
structureNotes: Only metal liquid at room temperature; solidifies below -39°C.
